page.title: 02BOLDRE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: Boldre Parish Council has 1O elected resident councillors and 1 clerk. Elections are held every 4 years and members can stand for re-election. The Parish has a population of about 2O5O and an area of 615O acres. There are 1665 people on the electoral register and the rateable value is Â£24OOOO. The amount precepted from the District Council for 1985/6 was Â£375O producing a Parish rate of 1.6p. The Parish extends from the coastline between the mouth of the Lymington River and Pitts Deep in the south to Setley in the north and from the Lymington River and Battramsley in the west to East End and Crockford Bridge in the east. The Parish Council meets twice a month to discuss matters of local interest and to represent the views of the Parish to other bodies. These meetings are open to the public.
